text: and it is an absolute pleasure to
announce with eight thousand four
hundred and fifty one votes the leader
or the UK Independence Party Diane James
after a ballots of party members who had
a choice of five candidates it was Diane
James a former businesswoman and Deputy
Chair of the party who emerged the
winner way ahead of her nearest rival
and she immediately sought to
differentiate herself from a predecessor
Nigel Faraj the darling of the party
faithful I am NOT
Nigel like I'm not even Nigel light I
will never ever pretend to be so what I
will be doing is stepping into his
leadership shoes but I will be doing
everything to achieve the political
success that he's handing over to me and
to you she's long enjoyed a high profile
in the party but now needs to reunite
you get after the acrimony which
surrounded the leadership contest and
she's clear her first priority will be
to ensure that government does not
compromise in the negotiations on
leaving the European Union no to a
European Union associate membership no
to brexit light no to single market
controls and no to unrestricted or
uncontrolled freedom of movement into
this country as for Nigel Faraj who's
already played a key role in securing
the brexit vote in June he's now
planning to tour European countries to
encourage others to break away but he'll
also be watching carefully what happens
here in the coming months we can be very
proud of the fact that we won the war
but we now must win the peace and the
only mechanism to put pressure on the
government to keep the debate live and
to make sure that those seventeen point
four million people get what they voted
for is for you Kip to be healthy and
you get to be strong and unity is a key
question for you Kip now with the party
having already achieved what it was set
up to do and with its most charismatic
and successful leader now bowing out a
new direction is needed
Richard Galpin BBC news
